greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: The smallest prime that does not divide the prime product form (A276086) of the primorial base expansion of n.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..32768
Index entries for sequences related to primorial base
formula: For all odd n, a(n) > A276088(n).
mathematica: With[{b = MixedRadix[Reverse@ Prime@ Range@ 12]}, Table[Block[{p = 2}, While[Mod[#, p] == 0, p = NextPrime@ p]; p] &@ Apply[Times, Power @@@ # &@ Transpose@ {Prime@ Range@ Length@ #, Reverse@ #}] &@ IntegerDigits[n, b], {n, 0, 105}]] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Oct 22 2019 *)
program: (PARI) A326810(n) = { my(i=1, p=2); while(n && (n%p), n = n\p; p = nextprime(1+p)); (p); };
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 19 2019
